column4: I can't boot into Vista.  When I try it loads and then says "Startup Repair is checking system for problems.  Attempting Repairs........Repairing disk errors.  This might take over an hour to complete."  I can't cancel the thing and it never finishes.  What can I do?
That's not an Ubuntu question, perhaps ask in ##windows for vista-relaed issues
Any idea of what the last thing was that happened that might be relevent? updates,downloads,cold reboots, etc?

I'm not sure if Windows still has the boot menu you can access by F8 key and select Safe Mode or so on, but perhaps worth trying before using some recovery strategy off the bootable cd like fixmbr or so on
